user.biography:
Author. Cook. Workshops. Travel.
New cookbook ‘Old World Italian’’ out NOW. ❤️@oddthor 
Torino based & currently writing new book!

node.text:
Shot by @louiseodd
Edited by @evaaaasion 
Kimono by @nocarnationsvintage 
#bazaaritalia #bazaartv

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on August 07, 2021 tagging @oddthor. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
My father recently passed away. My family and I have been battling by the waves of grief and sorrow, the mixed emotions, extreme sadness, but also frustration due to the pandemic and all the pain it has caused. As I type this, I am in Hong Kong, locked in a hotel room under strict quarantine rules so I can eventually be with my mother, console her and help her carry on. Mourning is a long process, and I want to focus on all the happiness we shared. This summer, I am looking at life in retrospect, connecting all the dots leading to my roots. My husband Oddur is taking care of all the children, they are waiting like little angels for me and their grandmother to come back soon. We will be reunited, all of us.
Oddur just sent me these photos today and I find them particularly touching, not only am I missing them like crazy, but I can see our family traits in all of them. I see my father’s eyes, his smile, his cheek bones. Family is everything. Please give an extra hug to all your loved ones. Hold on tight. Mimi x 
🕊🤍🕊🤍🕊

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on August 07, 2021 tagging @oddthor. May be an image of indoor.
Photo by Mimi Thorisson on August 07, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and outdoors.
Photo by Mimi Thorisson on August 07, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, child, people sitting and indoor.
Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on August 03, 2021 tagging @champagne_bollinger. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
I love entertaining, hosting friends, a small simple gathering or a large fancy one. There is magic around the table, friends or family sharing food and wine, laughter and stories. 
I also love the moment just before, it's a bit like setting a stage, creating atmosphere, choosing what to serve and how. It's the moment of joy and anticipation, my guests arriving any minute, I know we'll have fun but I want to give it an extra touch, add more flowers, brighten the table. 
Tea-time is a big favorite of mine, neither lunch or dinner, just a luxurious moment of the day when you can mix and match, have what you like, not because you need it but because you want to.
I like to offer a mix of sweet and savoury, biscuits and cheeses, little sandwiches, creamy meringues. Nothing goes better with such an occasion than Champagne, it makes everything festive and elegant, it makes my guests feel special and the rosy color goes equally well with the table setting and the hour as the subtle pinot noir notes combine perfectly with either a decadent cake or a sumptuous cheese.
Of course, when I'm setting the table I sometimes can't resist pouring myself a glass just before ... just to get in the mood. @champagne_bollinger 

#wearebolly #champagnebollinger 
#partnership

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on August 03, 2021 tagging @champagne_bollinger. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.
Photo by Mimi Thorisson on August 03, 2021.
Photo by Mimi Thorisson on August 03, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.
Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 30, 2021 tagging @parcodeiprincipisorrento. May be an image of body of water.

node.text: We arrived in Sorrento 3 weeks ago, we'll stick around for a while longer, it's the land of lemons and blue sea. #summer #sorrento

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 28, 2021 tagging @diorbeauty. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text:
I have always admired Christian Dior’s passion for flowers and roses were his favorite. This summer, I am loving the micro-huile de rose advanced serum @diorbeauty combining all the powers of the rose de Granville. Glowing from inside and out a
+ smelling like a rose garden. #diorprestige #diorskincare #ad

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 28, 2021 tagging @diorbeauty. May be an image of 1 person.
Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 28, 2021 tagging @diorbeauty. May be an image of fragrance and cosmetics.
Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 28, 2021 tagging @diorbeauty. May be an image of 1 person and standing.
Photo shared by Mimi Thorisson on July 16, 2021 tagging @belmondhotelcaruso, @ancientkallos, and @amalfi_lemon_experience. May be an image of 1 person, food, outdoors and tree.

node.text:
Amalfi = Lemons 🍋 

Last week we had the great pleasure of visiting a lemon farm in the hills right above Amalfi. Like so many good things in Italy this is a family affair that stretches back 7 generations. @amalfi_lemon_experience is a small farm, certainly very far from the mass produced stuff you can get in supermarkets everywhere, the farming is sustainable and organic and most importantly, the lemons are incredibly delicious. The variety is called Sfusato Amalfetano, they are bigger and longer than typical lemons, the skin much thicker and tastier. Gianmarco Aceto, from the youngest generation of the Aceto's told me his family uses lemons for absolutely everything, they eat them on their own as a salad (with the skin), use them in tea when they have a sore throat etc. The Sfusato lemon is delicious when used in cooking, I stuck around with Lucian to observe the cooking class the family offers to tourists and locals - it was all very fun and tasty, they use the pulp of the lemon to create the pasta sauce rather than the zest and the results were super fresh and delicious. 
They say that when life gives you lemons you should make lemonade, but these ones are so amazing that you can just eat them right off the tree. Grazie for the tour @aceto.gianmarco 🍋🍋🍋 and for introducing me to the farm! @belmondhotelcaruso 

#amalfi #lemons #italy

node.text:
Our Belmond trip continued with the wonderful @belmondvillasanmichele in Florence. A beautiful old monastery converted into a haven of beauty above Florence.
This is turning out to be quite a spectacular food journey which is how I like it. We started with a breathtaking picnic overlooking Florence (some of us had a romantic dinner in the garden after that). The following morning all of us participated in the most fun cooking class I can imagine with the talented young chef, @alessandro.cozzolino. He's so passionate and full of life, says he made his first gnocchi (his favorite) with his Nonna when he was Lucian's age and by the time he was 13 he had found his calling. We had so much to talk about and I have a lot of admiration for his approach. Alessandro is originally from Caserta, near Naples and he says all his family are crazy about food. He's very young but he's been a Chef for many years, spent time in Hong Kong (so we could talk about that too). Their kitchen project is very exciting, building on Tuscan classics but with a modern approach, all the produce is very local and sustainable.
We made a Tuscan Panzanella and gnocchi with the freshest, simplest tomato sauce. Then Tiramisu. It was all delicious and we all loved the experience.
That night Oddur and I had a table for two in the kitchen, it's more than a chef's table, it's quite literally in the middle of the kitchen. Somehow, in the middle of all the action it was also romantic, a shared experience - I guess we both love food.
This is a kitchen for gentlemen, no shouting, just a gentle rhythm of efficiency. 
The food was simply outstanding, a few highlights were the Scarpaccia with the round Florentine zucchini and Follonica edible flowers and the wild duck raviolo with Lari cherries with crispy amaranta. Buonissimi! 

#TheArtofBelmond 
#TasteofBelmond 
#florence #italy

location.name: Villa San Michele, A Belmond Hotel

node.text:
There was a time when a good hotel meant checking in, marvelling at the novelty of the mini bar, scrolling through the tv stations - when the highest form of luxury was the in-room trouser press. Well, not quite but still, it's fair to say that hotels have grown up, evolved with the times. The best ones have gone from good places to stay to a whole world of their own, where luxury doesn't just mean gold and marble but an experience you can't have elsewhere. At the same time invigorating and relaxing, educational and enjoyable.
I think it's fair to say that Belmond Hotels are a group of such establishments, without any parallel and it's our privilege this week to try out 3 of their Italian properties. Our journey starts with @belmondcastellodicasole, a Tuscan castle about an hour from Florence. Let's begin with the food (you know me) - everything was just so delicious. From the first bite at the pool, a Tuscan burger with irresistible fries, a pizza masterclass that turned out to be incredible, the kids made the best pizzas. And for dinner we had a more refined affair and even more delicious. Then it started again. Talking about experiences - our aperitivo at the "Enchanted table" was just that, enchanted - and Gaïa, our local artist, got inspired by all the beauty and did not one but two Medusa inspired creations using her sister as a model. 
When we checked out I told the staff which were all fabulous that my best compliment was that while the whole thing was luxurious and elegant to a fault it also felt very much like a true Tuscan experience, very local, very true. And that to me is true luxury. 
Grazie to the @belmondcastellodicasole team! 

#TheArtofBelmond 
#TasteofBelmond

location.name: Castello di Casole, A Belmond Hotel

node.text: As good as they get. Lunch. It’s always a treat to be in Florence. And no trip here is complete without a meal at Trattoria Sostanza. We actually had 2 lunches here and managed to try all the classics. Here are some of my favorites: the bistecca Fiorentina, the tortino di carciofi (a flan like omelet torta with artichokes), the meringue cake and the butter chicken. Complimenti  @trattoriasostanzafirenze! #firenze #italy

node.text:
We had such a fun day in Florence yesterday - @alexander.kraft invited me to try out the new women’s collection from @alexanderkraft.montecarlo. I really enjoyed wearing this “manly” but somehow also feminine, elegant clothes in luxurious and tailored fabrics. The biggest surprise was how much I liked wearing pants - which I hardly ever do, I even loved the jeans.
The day ended with a great tailgating party, countless dandies and a handful of women drinking red drinks in the evening sun with Florence as a backdrop! #pittiuomo #alexandercraftmontecarlo #tailored

node.text:
Now that the kids are out of school we have a bit more time on our hands - a trip to the beach or a day in Milan.
It was a pleasure to take half the kids to Nobu for the most sumptuous and delicious lunch imaginable - and a special treat to be invited into Chef Antonio D’Angelo’s kitchen and see him make the gyoza di maialino, scampo, gazpacho di mandorla e cipolla di amazu. They absolutely melt in your mouth with the lightest almond broth. Like many of Italy’s finest chefs Antonio comes from Napoli and he brings that southern flair and freshness into his kitchen. The feast he rolled out for us last week was truly beyond and while they sent out food for an army my young troops loved it so much they finished every bite. Now they all want to have their birthdays here! Thank you @chef_antoniodangelo @nobumilano @armanirestaurants #milano #italy

node.text:
We are delighted to announce 2 new workshops next year in our adopted home region of Piemonte, Italy. I've continuously been one of the optimists during this pandemic and while that has sometimes been premature I think we can safely plan for next year without any worries ... it feels great not to just see the light at the end of the tunnel but to actually have one foot out already :)

The dates for next year are:

June 2-4, 2022 - The Piemonte spring food and wine workshop
October 13-15, 2022 - The Piemonte fall food and wine workshop

Now we have lived in this wonderful part of Italy for three years and we continue to be amazed by the richness and beauty of the region. The food culture is spectacular, the wines, well does anyone not love Barlolo and Barbaresco, the lakes, the mountains, the rich farmlands south of Torino. And talking about Torino, our adopted hometown - so beautiful and underrated, surrounded by green hills and blue mountains. 
We'll spend three days touring the region, cooking and feasting together, drinking local wine and taking in the sights and the history. I'm very proud of Piemonte and the longer I live here the more I realise how special it is, how rich it is. Piemonte deserves a wider recognition - of course Barolos are world famous, so are the white truffles of Alba, but the local cuisine, the beauty of, not only Torino but the countless towns and villages, the hazelnuts, the chocolate heritage, the dishes people know but just not where they come from. Piemonte is 10 out of 10 and I can't wait for you to discover it. #mimithorisson #workshop #planahead #italy 

If you are interested to join or want more information please email us at mangerworkshop@gmail.com
